definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: She screamed when going into the room.
sentences.chinese: 她走进房间时便尖声惊叫起来。

sentences.english: Her screams brought the neighbours running.
sentences.chinese: 她的惊叫声引得邻居们都跑来了。
电影太暴力，我们尖声惊叫。

sentences.english: Grandma mouse also shouted, …… . But Jules did not care.
sentences.chinese: 鼠奶奶也发出了阵阵惊叫声，这一家子简直乱了套。

sentences.english: Skirl and skreigh, but for thine ears, aye, lown 'tis –
sentences.chinese: 尖啸和惊叫，若没有你的耳朵，是的，都会平息。

sentences.english: A girl screams in mock fright.
sentences.chinese: 有个姑娘假作一声惊叫。

sentences.english: That's why I always, wake up screaming.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我一醒来就惊叫的原因。

sentences.english: Her screams drew passers-by to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 她的惊叫声把过路人吸引到了现场。

sentences.english: A sharp cry of surprise disturbed the tranquility of the night.
sentences.chinese: 尖厉的惊叫声打破了夜晚的宁静。

sentences.english: All of a sudden, she uttered a cry and stopped short.
sentences.chinese: 她突然惊叫一声，立刻停了下来。

sentences.english: All of a sudden he heard a cry above him.
sentences.chinese: 忽然他听到上方传来一阵惊叫声。

sentences.english: "You jest, " he exclaimed, recoiling a few paces.
sentences.chinese: “你在开玩笑，”他惊叫一声并往后退了几步。

sentences.english: Wilson threw a body aside, and then stepped back with an exclamation .
sentences.chinese: 威尔逊推开了一具尸体，突然惊叫一声，往后直退。

sentences.english: Instead, he said, people got "a whimper, not a scream."
sentences.chinese: 事与愿违，人们报之以“呜咽，而非惊叫”。

sentences.english: At the sight of the dog, the thief gave a high-pitched shriek and jumped behind the sofa.
sentences.chinese: 那个贼一看见狗就一声惊叫，竟跳到沙发后面。

sentences.english: The incense suddenly exclaimed, and vigorously developed into the room to ready and keep the .
sentences.chinese: 金香突然惊叫，大力和发达冲入房把肃恭驱赶。

definition: to cry out in alarm or surprise
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
in a great rush/in a flurry
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
